body: I think the problem is that https://pulsar.apache.org/api/client/org/apache/pulsar/client/api/ConsumerBuilder.html#subscriptionInitialPosition-org.apache.pulsar.client.api.SubscriptionInitialPosition- is not exposed in C++ client (and Python/Go)
@rsamo Thanks for reporting this. Created PRs for upgrade bouncy castle and guava. I don't see any usage of Jetty 9.3.11.20160721. The version we're currently using is 9.4.12.v20180830
No problem at all! I think 9.4.12.v20180830 will be fine actually to fix those vulnerabilities.
There are some issues with the shading of jclouds and the new guava. @jiazhai Do we still need the `jcloud-shaded` module or that was a stop-gap solution?

@ambition119 the ack and fail implementation around transaction is still not correct. and I think you need to add more tests around that area in order to make this implementation solid.

Once you addressed that problem, the change is ready to go.

thanks @ivankelly 

Can you just push the change to this branch?

run cpp tests
run java8 tests
@jerrypeng I think that change can be done in a subsequent change since its kind of not related to this. I will merge this and work on that later.

Yes, as @sijie mentioned, I am preparing a PR for this. @foreversunyao 
And current approach is to poll periodically from the client.

Thanks a lot @merlimat for the notes. 
Yes, the implementation will be on top of SASL, which is similar as how kerberos is supported in bookkeeper

@aahmed-se the link you mentioned throws 404. Can post the code snippet here. Thanks
@ganeshs try again I have made the repo public.

Hi @sijie 

I've moved the config, but where would you suggest that we add the test? I've made some efforts and discovered a couple of candidate test locations like ```PulsarFunctionAdminTest``` and ```BrokerServiceTest```. However, they don't seem to be testing configs related to Managed Ledger and the creation of z-nodes.

@aahmed-se Thanks for quick revert. The example code is under the package `org.apache.pulsar` and hence the start() method is accessible. It cannot be used outside of the package. This will require making the method public or protected
Go ahead and open an issue I will make sure it gets changed.

@ConcurrencyPractitioner 

I think you need to verify following cases:

when autoCreateTopic is disabled, 1) you can't publish or consume from topics when topics are not explicitly created. 2) you can create partitioned and non-partitions topics from pulsar admin rest endpoint.

You can add a new test case to pulsar-broker module. There are plenty test cases using MockedPulsarServiceBaseTest, you can check them out as examples.

run integration tests

Is there any update on this feature request? I'll need to add a "marker" message to my writes if this is not coming relatively soon. Right now I just read from the beginning until I see the actual first message... but that is not going to scale at all.
